messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi. I'm kind of scared. There's a man knocking on my windows and trying to get into my house.
What city are you in?
Tamarack, Florida.
What's the address?
7160, South State Boulevard.
Do you know this person?
Yes, he's my ex.
Okay, and he is not welcome at your house, correct?
Yes, he knows that.
And he's trying to get into your house right now?
Yes, and he's not letting me or my roommates be at peace. He's knocking on my windows. I've been telling him to leave for the past hour, and he hasn't been listening.
Okay. Is it a house or an apartment?
It's like a villa.
Alright. Is he white, black, Hispanic?
He's Hispanic.
What's his name?
Mario.
Do you know what he's wearing?
Last time I saw him, about three hours ago, he was wearing a black shirt and blue jeans. I'm scared he might be violent.
What's your name?
My name is Anne.
Does he have a history of violence?
Yes, he does.
Do you know if he has any weapons?
Not that I know of.
Okay. Stay on the line with me.
Oh my God, he just broke my window!
Ma'am, is he inside your house now?
Yes, he just broke into my house!
Alright, can you safely get out of the house?
No, I can't! He's in here!
Okay, ma'am. The police are on their way. Stay in a safe place and keep talking to me.
Okay. He's yelling at me. He has a knife!
Stay calm, and keep yourself safe. The police will be there shortly.
